reviews.review_msg: this man makes you WORK for your grade, so don't go into his class thinking you'll get an A by doing the bare minimum- hist classes are hard! his grading criteria are basically non-existent which sucks bc this is a w course. but it's not impossible to do decent if you go to class and actually participate.

This is a hybrid class but it's not listed as hybrid. Kenny also doesn't provide any criteria or examples whatsoever of what he is expecting regarding assignments which makes the class seriously hard. All my other classes suffered due to the stress of this course. I seriously do not recommend taking this class if you don't want to crash out.

Kenny makes his classes hybrid without telling students ahead of time. Forcing students through weekly tests that weren't even focused on the main online lecture points. The online lectures were boring and difficult to watch. There was no proper feedback or grading scales on assignments.

The emphasis on the group project was too much. It felt like he was looking for a few things from each group and you would be dinged if you did not focus on them in your project and paper. I really enjoyed the course material from his assigned regular readings but the city studio project just gave this course an overall vague feeling.

Professor Kenny is a really nice person and his lectures are pretty good, but the way he taught this course left me rather disappointed. The heavy emphasis on a group project (in collaboration with citystudio) overshadowed the rest of the course material, and though the project was alright, in the end I felt like I learned very little.

Ok, so I didn't get a great mark in this class (B-), but this is not really a reflection of him as a prof. I was just not interested in the material. Not his fault. This makes me qualified to rate him. He is passionate about this subject clearly. He is also understanding. He marks really hard, IMO, but he challenges you to do better.
I feel like Prof. Kenny doesn't deserve such a low rating. Overall he is a fair marker and makes some funny jokes. As long as you try and put in the effort you can do well.
Super nice guy. Don't listen to all these bad reviews he's a fair marker and a funky dude. I would take a class with him again in a heart beat.

Avoid at all costs. He is extremely unclear about his grading criteria.   His feedback is useless. However, he tries to make the course interactive and fun but he is not a good teacher.  Will drop your GPA.

Awful professor. Extremely unclear about assignment expectations and gives unhelpful feedback. He has no desire to help you or make time for questions. He doesn't care if you do well, he is not understanding at all when it comes to confusion in the class, late assignments, etc. Horrible person, professor, -10/10 would not recommend

This class was tough and the prof has serious expectations - slackers are not appreciated - but I learned a lot and the field trips and creative projects were different from the norm. Prof. Kenny is involved in a lot of community projects and is a great resource if you love history and want to immerse yourself. Recommended for serious students.

Nice guy and he tries to make it a good class. The reality is that for all of his strengths, teaching  is not one of them. That said you can still succeed in the class especially if you write a good essay. It's not a walk in the park but that does not mean you should avoid taking classes with him. Mixes it up with field trips.
Vague about assignment expectations, class is conducted as if everyone already knows historiographical terms. Gives very little feedback on written assignments.
Terrible prof extremely hard marker on essays and when you ask for feedback he doesnt even tell you how to improve. Going to class is basically pointless because you are only tested on the readings.
vague about assignments and was not helpful during tutorials. nice guy but always spaced out. doesn't interject when people ramble and lets the class get way off focus

Extremely vague with his expectations for assignments. Some of the tutorial readings were quite dry. He made us do a take home final which took most people about 7 hours to complete. It was an interesting class in the end but could have been better.

Extremely vague with his expectations for assignments. Possessed unrealistically high expectations and was a very difficult marker. Some of the tutorial readings were quite dry and chosen not for their content but for their length. It was an interesting class (liked the last 2 books, field trips, and  guest speakers), but was overall too difficult
Good prof. did not always communicate material clearly & was sometimes spaced out. the class was interesting overall and he wasn't too difficult of a marker
